pages.text: Almost every single method of dimensional travel has been entirely $(o)disabled$().$(br2)While you're welcome to try, I would recommend against it, as many are a costly and ultimately futile waste of time. Some, like leaving The Bumblezone from the bottom, will just $(k)shunt you into limbo$().

Instead, you'll need to make use of the Stargate Journey mod to hop between dimensions. To get started, use the Archeology Table as a workstation for a villager and level them up to level 5, and they'll trade you a map to a buried Stargate.

Once you've located the buried stargate, you'll need to excavate said buried stargate. Within the ruins you'll find a gate, a mysterious device known as a 'DHD', and a monolith containing the address pointing towards the Nether.
pages.title: Finding the Gate
Dialing the Gate
pages.text: Once all the of the above have been excavated and the space above the gate has been cleared, right click on the DHD and dial the address that was listed on the monolith. Stand clear, the gate will 'kawoosh' and open a path to the Nether.

pages.title: Welcome to Hell
pages.text: Prepare for an adventure. Once inside you can find an address taking you back to the Overworld right outside the room you spawn in. Addresses to other dimensions can be found within dungeons around the Nether, bring some good gear, you won't be able to cheese them via breaking blocks.

pages.title: Well...
pages.text: At least, that's what I would say if the dungeons were ready. Instead, while they're in development, be on the lookout in the Nether for boxes made of quartz and red stained glass. These 'caches' can be broken open to find a cartouche containing an address pointing to a dimension instead.
